parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE. The post includes a CMF number: "CMF: 11240027". This strongly suggests electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for electoral materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. The post clearly refers to Manolache Vasile, identifying him as a Senator candidate for the S.O.S. România party in Bistrița-Năsăud County.  His position on the ballot (8) is also explicitly stated. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message but a public announcement promoting Manolache Vasile's candidacy. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. The primary objective of the post is to promote Manolache Vasile's candidacy. The message ("Sprijinim afacerile locale pentru o economie puternică!") while seemingly general, is framed within the context of his candidacy and aims to garner support for him.  The inclusion of his position on the ballot further reinforces this electoral objective. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. While the post touches upon a relevant societal issue (supporting local businesses), it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It's presented as a campaign message directly promoting a candidate, not as an unbiased news piece. </journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The post is not expressing a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted political advertisement designed to influence voters' choices in the upcoming election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>569215805798224</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a candidate (Manolache Vasile), uses campaign-style messaging, targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has a clear electoral objective (promoting the candidate). The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as electoral material.  The post's content, while mentioning local businesses, is clearly designed to influence voters in favor of Manolache Vasile. The argument that it's about supporting local businesses is weak, as the context and presentation strongly suggest an electoral purpose.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>MANOLACHE VASILE</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>SOS</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Momentum Motion Pictures SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări electorale pe Facebook (ID: 569215805798224), care promovează candidatura lui Manolache Vasile (Partidul S.O.S. România) la Senat în județul Bistrița-Năsăud, folosind mesaje cu scop electoral ("Sprijinim afacerile locale pentru o economie puternică!") și un număr CMF (11240027),  având un efect electoral pozitiv asupra candidatului. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 300-399 RON, a atins 80.000-90.000 de impresii, conform Ad Library, și a vizat o audiență de 100.000-500.000 de persoane, demonstrând intenția clară de a influența votul.  Contact: contact@momentum.com.ro, +40767277777.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
